channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How to Protect Your Company From the Worst Effects of Social Media
item.description: TikTok, Instagram, Pinterest can be huge distractions at work. Other social content can derail team collaboration.

item.title: Gold Investors May Suddenly Be Rotating Into Bitcoin
item.description: Gold prices fell while bitcoin climbed sharply.

item.title: Why High Performers Build Smaller Networks, Backed By Organizational Science
item.description: While correlation isn’t always causation, research shows the bigger your network, the less likely you are to succeed.

item.title: Sam Altman’s OpenAI is coming for Wall Street’s grunt workers as AI continues to transform the entry level
item.description: Experts say automation of low-level tasks in finance will “transform” rather than “eliminate” roles on Wall Street.

item.title: This book cover designer went viral on TikTok. Then his career took off
item.description: In 2022, Elisha Zepeda had given up on becoming a designer and was working as a barista at an Oregon bookstore. Today, he’s a salaried book cover desi...

item.title: Ray Dalio says his AI clone will be able to give you investment and career insights whenever you want
item.description: Ray Dalio has a waitlist for “Digital Ray,” an AI clone designed to talk to the public.

item.title: Why Trump is allowed to tear down part of the White House
item.description: The White House, one of the most historically significant and secure buildings in the United States, is being torn apart. Demolition crews were on the...

item.title: Can Europe find the political energy to become competitive again?
item.description: “Europe is not just a beautiful idea; it’s a powerful and stable economic space. And that’s what we want to preserve," says Stéphane Séjourné.

item.title: Recruiters dish on ‘ghost jobs’: Why companies post them, and how to outsmart them
item.description: Either you’ve lived it, or you’ve heard about it from friends: the endless job search , featuring hundreds of applications sent. Maybe one or two comp...

item.title: Reid Hoffman and David Sacks Are Feuding on X Over AI and ‘Dirty Tricks’
item.description: Hoffman recently opened up to Inc. about technology’s role in politics and his vision for AI regulation.

item.title: The case for including crypto in your 401(k)
item.description: In July, President Trump signed an executive order aimed at expanding access to alternative investments like private equity and cryptocurrency in reti...

item.title: Google’s Pixel Watch 4 is the least-annoying smartwatch I’ve ever used
item.description: The best thing I can say about Google’s Pixel Watch 4 is that I don’t think about it all that much. Whenever I wear my Apple Watch, it’s kind of a nui...

item.title: Schneider Electric CEO Olivier Blum credits his time as CHRO for shaping his leadership style: Success is ‘90% about the people you put in the job’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: The Role of Entrepreneurship in Low-Income Communities
item.description: Majora Carter, a real estate developer and urban revitalization strategy consultant, is proof that you don’t have to leave to succeed.

item.title: This Global 500 energy CEO says the model for the global corporation that worked for 20 years is obsolete—here’s what he’s building instead
item.description: In a wide-ranging interview with Fortune, Schneider Electric CEO Olivier Blum, lays out his vision for his vast enterprise.
